page.title: 05ECOLOGY
page.content: {CONSERVATION, WEATHER, WILDLIFE, {FOOTPATHS. { {CONSERVATION :}GENERALLY GLENROTHES IS CLEAN AND TIDY. THE COUNCIL REGULARLY PLANT TREES, SHRUBS, ETC., MOST OF WHICH HAVE SURVIVED THE VANDALISM WHICH, SADLY, IS INCREASING. THERE IS STILL SOME POLLUTION FROM FACTORIES. {WEATHER :}THE CLIMATE IS TEMPERATE AND THE RAINFALL AVERAGE, BUT IN RECENT YEARS MINOR WATER SHORTAGES HAVE OCCURRED IN SUMMER MONTHS. {WILDLIFE :}THERE ARE MANY AND VARIOUS BIRDS, MOST COMMON THE SPARROW, THEN THE SEAGULL, THEN THE CROW. OTHER WILDLIFE RANGES FROM ANTS TO FOXES. {FOOTPATHS :}ARE NUMEROUS AND WIDESPREAD, AND ONE SUCH PATH WHICH TRAVERSES THE TOWN IS NAMED{BOBLINGEN {WAY}AFTER OUR TWIN TOWN IN GERMANY.
